alert.note: Alert for Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:10PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Elko County through 945 PM PDT... At 908 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lamoille, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lamoille, and Lamoille Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Southwest Elko County
